channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023090295
item.description:
Report E-2023090295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading freight into a trailer, forklift operator drove the forkblades of his forklift into the bottom of two drums that were already staged in the trailer consequently puncturing them and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into recovery containers as were the two punctured drums.

item.title: Report E-2023090294
item.description:
Report E-2023090294

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When picking up freight to load into trailer, forklift operator placed the forkblades of his forklift into the pallet of freight and when doing so the forkblades struck the bottom of a drum that was staged on the pallet that had fallen in between a broken board on the pallet. When the drum was struck by the forkblade it punctured the drum which in turn contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2023081588
item.description:
Report X-2023081588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort, it was raining and the bottom of the package had gotten damp. When the package handler had picked it up the glue holding the bottom of the box became loose and the box opened up at the bottom and the bottles came out and fell onto the floor. One of the bottles broke when it hit the floor. A manager placed absorb powder and pads on it to clean it up and placed the contents into a yellow hazmat drum. DescribePack: The bottom of the box became damp due to the rain and the glue became loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a yellow hazmat drum, sealed, and placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was leaking on the loading dock at door 315. The item was put aside, and QA was called. At that time QA obtained the package with the proper PPE. No injuries were reported and or damages to other packages. DescribePack: The item was dented with a small crack causing it to leak inside its package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: This item was placed the correct side up and concealed in a hazmat bag

item.title: Report X-2023081543

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I Was called to unload this morning to inspect a hazmat that came off a trailer leaking. upon inspecting 2 of the 4 caps on the bottles were missing and that was the cause of the leaking. DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: I Put cleaning pads down on the floor to adsorb the liquid that was on the floor and truck.

item.title: Report E-2023090292
item.description:
Report E-2023090292

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a box that had been crushed by the the freight loaded on top of it. This top freight caused one of the boxes to get crush consequently crushing the inner bottle to be crushed as well which contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the crushed box and inner container.

item.title: Report E-2023090274
item.description:
Report E-2023090274

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While freight was being loaded into trailer forklift operator went to pickup a pallet and when he did the forkblades hit two pails that had fallen through the pallet because one of the pallet boards was broken. As a result, when the forkblade hit the two pails it slightly punctured them and consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the two punctured pails.

item.description:
Report X-2023081238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking at door 303. Package was contained in a hazmat retrieval tote. Neutralizing powder was spread on the liquid spill. DescribePack: The cap of the leaking bottle leaked even when the cap was fully tightened. Threads did not provide a liquid tight seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was quickly place in a tote and the spill was neutralized.

DescribePack: The cap of the bottle seems to loose and cause a internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to contain the leakage from the package.

item.title: Report E-2023080447
item.description:
Report E-2023080447

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: SCOTIA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON 08/04/23 at 07:57 AM in the area of MP QC169.9 on the Mohawk Subdivision the M36304 traveling westbound derailed multiple railcars. 9 of the railcars were residue hazardous material railcars. No release of hazardous materials or package failure occurred due to the incident. State Route 5 eastbound was closed due to the derailment and Amtrak passengers were delayed. HEPACO, a CSX response contractor, and David Scoons, a CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials, responded to the incident to perform assessments of the damaged tank cars as well as ensure that no additional critical damage was sustained during removal of the residue tank cars. All cars were removed from the derailment site without incident.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of ethanol (un1170) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 9 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When unloading a trailer the package came out being crushed and leaking, managers quickly put it in the bin. DescribePack: The package was crushed then it leaked and torn the bottom of box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Managers put it in the bin and move it away as far away from package handlers as possible.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080891
item.description:
Report X-2023080891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and punctured on damage table. All four 1-gallon bottles of Foam-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner were removed and inspected. All caps were found secured and taped with one bottle with a few less tablespoons of product than the other 3. No punctures or leaks were found at the time of discovery. DescribePack: internal partition corroded and exterior side of package corroded by inner liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: NA
